references.paper_title: USAD: Unsupervised anomaly detection on multivariate time series
references.reason: This paper introduces USAD, an unsupervised anomaly detection method crucial for evaluating the stealthiness of BACKTIME's backdoor attacks.

references.paper_title: Targeted backdoor attacks on deep learning systems using data poisoning
references.reason: This foundational paper on targeted backdoor attacks provides the theoretical basis for BACKTIME's approach, influencing its design and methodology.

references.paper_title: Badnets: Identifying vulnerabilities in the machine learning model supply chain
references.reason: The concept of BadNets, introduced in this paper, directly inspired BACKTIME's exploration of backdoor attacks in the context of machine learning model supply chains.

references.paper_title: Backdoor attacks on time series: A generative approach
references.reason: This paper directly addresses backdoor attacks on time series, informing BACKTIME's design choices and providing a relevant comparison point for evaluating its effectiveness.

references.paper_title: Backdoor embedding in convolutional neural network models via invisible perturbation
references.reason: This work on invisible perturbations in CNNs provided valuable insights into creating stealthy backdoor attacks, which directly influenced BACKTIME's trigger generation strategy.
